meanings.definition: To officially make someone a priest or minister.
meanings.sent1: The bishop will ordain the new priest at the church ceremony.
meanings.sent2: The church will ordain the candidate after years of study and training.
meanings.sent3: It was a joyous occasion when the community gathered to ordain the young man as a minister.
meanings.sent4: The sacred ritual of ordaining a priest has been passed down for generations.
meanings.sent5: The act of ordaining someone as a priest is a solemn and meaningful tradition.

meanings.sent1: The king will ordain a new law to protect the citizens.
meanings.sent2: The government can ordain regulations to ensure public safety.
meanings.sent3: The mayor decided to ordain a city-wide cleanup day to improve the environment.
meanings.sent4: The judge can ordain a fair trial for all individuals involved.
meanings.sent5: The council will ordain a new policy to address the community's needs.

meanings.definition: To establish or enact something with authority.
meanings.sent1: The company will ordain a new dress code for employees to follow.
meanings.sent2: The school board can ordain a policy regarding student behavior.
meanings.sent3: The committee decided to ordain a new rule for membership eligibility.
meanings.sent4: The council will ordain a plan to revitalize the downtown area.
meanings.sent5: The government may ordain a program to support small businesses.
